bibl.title: Ephemeral Alexandria: The Pageantry of the Ptolemaic Court and Its Documentation.

series.title: Studies in the History of Art.

bibl.note: Αἱ τῶν πεντετηρίδων γραφαί, the wording used by Kallixeinos, suggests the existence of illustrated documentation. By positing this, gives an idea of the original illustrated roll through the concordance of the Kallixeinos text with imagery derived from an iconographic repertory extending from the early Hellenistic period to late antiquity.

bibl.title: Eius Virtutis Studiosi: Classical and Postclassical Studies in Memory of Frank Edward Brown (1908-1988)

bibl.seg: MARABINI MOEVS Maria Teresa, Ephemeral Alexandria: The Pageantry of the Ptolemaic Court and Its Documentation.

Russell T. SCOTT and Ann REYNOLDS SCOTT (Edd.), Eius Virtutis Studiosi: Classical and Postclassical Studies in Memory of Frank Edward Brown (1908-1988) = Studies in the History of Art. 43. Symposium Papers. XXIII (Hanover - London, 1993) pp. 123-147, 26 figg. et 1 pl. coul.

Αἱ τῶν πεντετηρίδων γραφαί, the wording used by Kallixeinos, suggests the existence of illustrated documentation. By positing this, gives an idea of the original illustrated roll through the concordance of the Kallixeinos text with imagery derived from an iconographic repertory extending from the early Hellenistic period to late antiquity.
